); } function Home() { return (

Leading with Purpose

As a woman of color, my leadership is rooted in empathy, emotional intelligence, and a commitment to elevating voices often unheard. I strive to lead with integrity, cultural sensitivity, and a collaborative spirit.

About Me

I'm Mahek Bhagchandani, a graduate student in Industrial & Organizational Psychology at the University of New Haven. Since 2019, my academic and leadership journey has reflected my passion for inclusivity, talent development, and driving impactful initiatives.

); } function Bachelors() { return (

Bachelor's Achievements (2019–2022)

  • Dean's List for 4 semesters
  • Graduated summa cum laude (3.81 GPA)
  • Psi Chi Member
  • VP and Social Media Head of Debate Club
  • Participated in state and FIFA debate tournaments (Oct 2020 – May 2022)
  • Co-Founder & VP of South Asian Club: led cultural events and built inclusivity
); } function Masters() { return (

Master's Achievements (2023–Present)

  • Founder & President: Desi Chargers (iFest 2025 winner)
  • Graduate Assistant at OGISL (since April 2024)
  • Head of Relations: SHRM Chapter at UNH
  • OD & HR Intern at OGISL (Summer 2025)
  • Event Lead: Winter Ball, Glow Party, Trivia Nights, Comedy Show, Spring Trip
  • Researcher: Leadership style & job satisfaction (results available upon request)
  • Business Concept: Thrive Local (with branding, model, and app prototype)
  • Passions: Leadership, OD, HR Tech, Talent Acquisition, Inclusive Hiring
); } function Blog() { return (

Blog

Leading From the Margins: Why Inclusion Starts Within

June 2025

I didn’t always raise my hand first in class, but I always noticed who was never called on. As a South Asian woman in HR and psychology spaces, I’ve come to believe that leadership isn’t just about being seen—it’s about seeing others.
